item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! My name is Zifan Si - a second year Software Engineering student at McMaster University. I am passionate about combing my engineering skills into software field to impact the communities, starting from the one surrounding me. More details about my qualifications can be found on LinkedIn in here. Education Link to heading Bachelor of Engineering in Software Engineering (Co-op) McMaster University, 2026 GPA: 3.9 / 4.0 Awarded the McMaster Entrance Scholarship Extracurricular Activities Link to heading Member, McMaster Club Programming Languages Link to heading Java C/C++ HTML CSS Python MATLAB Tools Link to heading Autodesk Inventor Github Microsoft Office Hugo

item.title: Level 1 (Group) - Waste Disposal Prototype (Autodesk Inventor)
item.description: A mechanism that automates the depositing of waste containers. Summary Link to heading My team and I created a mechanism that could life a hopper to empty dispose of containers as part of a recycling system. The design is driven by a rotational actuator. With aid of the first link, the torque of the actuator will be transferred to the connecting link. The function of connecting link is to convert rotary motion into oscillating motion to push the final link.

item.title: Level 1 (Independent) - Autoclave Sorting Program (Python)
item.description: A Python program to control the movement of a robotic arm and its gripper to sort 6 autoclave locations. Check My Project On Github Summary Link to heading I developed a Python program that autonomously spawns and sorts autoclaves into the appropriate location based on specific attributes. The real-life application of this program would be for using these containers to store the surgical tools and sterilize them in the autoclave.
